20110123140848.000|20110123140849.000|CC1|ONE.                            
20110123140849.000|20110123140850.000|CC1|WHETHER FUTURE GENERATIONS      
20110123140850.000|20110123140852.000|CC1|WILL LEARN TO WRITE THEIR ABCs  
20110123140852.000|20110123140854.000|CC1|BY HAND AT ALL, HOWEVER, IS     
20110123140854.000|20110123140856.000|CC1|VERY MUCH IN DOUBT.             
20110123140856.000|20110123140857.000|CC1|SIGNING OFF IS THE TITLE OF     
20110123140857.000|20110123140859.000|CC1|OUR COVER STORY REPORTED NOW    
20110123140859.000|20110123140901.000|CC1|BY TRACY SMITH.                 
20110123140901.000|20110123140903.000|CC1|>> BOYS AND GIRLS, I'M GOING    
20110123140903.000|20110123140904.000|CC1|TO SHOW YOU HOW YOU MAKE THESE  
20110123140904.000|20110123140905.000|CC1|LETTERS.                        
20110123140905.000|20110123140908.000|CC1|SO WATCH HOW I DO THIS.         
20110123140908.000|20110123140910.000|CC1|DOWN, UP AND OVER.              
20110123140910.000|20110123140911.000|CC1|SEE THAT?                       
20110123140911.000|20110123140913.000|CC1|? I'M GOING TO SIT RIGHT DOWN   
20110123140913.000|20110123140917.000|CC1|AND WRITE MYSELF A LETTER ?     
20110123140917.000|20110123140919.000|CC1|>> Reporter: IF IT'S BEEN A     
20110123140919.000|20110123140920.000|CC1|WHILE SINCE YOU FELT THE        
20110123140920.000|20110123140921.000|CC1|EXCITEMENT....                  
20110123140921.000|20110123140922.000|CC1|>> THAT IS AMAZING.             
20110123140922.000|20110123140923.000|CC1|>> Reporter:... OR THE PAIN.    
20110123140923.000|20110123140925.000|CC1|>> CAN YOU ERASE IT AND TRY     
20110123140925.000|20110123140925.000|CC1|AGAIN.                          
20110123140925.000|20110123140927.000|CC1|>> Reporter:... OF PUTTING PEN  
20110123140927.000|20110123140931.000|CC1|TO PAPER, SPEND A FEW MOMENTS   
20110123140931.000|20110123140934.000|CC1|WITH KRYSTAL WALTERS'           
20110123140934.000|20110123140935.000|CC1|KINDERGARTEN CLASS IN UPPER     
20110123140935.000|20110123140936.000|CC1|ARLINGTON, OHIO.                
20110123140936.000|20110123140939.000|CC1|>> YOU CAN SEE SO MUCH MEANING  
20110123140939.000|20110123140941.000|CC1|AND PASSION IN THEIR            
20110123140941.000|20110123140941.000|CC1|PENMANSHIP.                     
20110123140941.000|20110123140943.000|CC1|YOU KNOW, EVEN IF IT'S, YOU     
20110123140943.000|20110123140945.000|CC1|KNOW, ALL IN CAPITALS AND A     
20110123140945.000|20110123140947.000|CC1|MIX, IT MAKES YOU SMILE.        
20110123140947.000|20110123140949.000|CC1|>> Reporter: HANDWRITING IS     
20110123140949.000|20110123140950.000|CC1|STILL AN ESSENTIAL SKILL FOR    
20110123140950.000|20110123140952.000|CC1|KIDS, BUT IN THE WORLD BEYOND   
20110123140952.000|20110123140954.000|CC1|SCHOOL, THE ONE FILLED WITH     
20110123140954.000|20110123140956.000|CC1|COMPUTERS AND CELL PHONES AND   
20110123140956.000|20110123140958.000|CC1|YOU NAME IT, WE'RE LOSING OUR   
20110123140958.000|20110123140959.000|CC1|GRIP ON PENMANSHIP.             
20110123140959.000|20110123141001.000|CC1|IT'S NOT THAT WE'RE NOT         
20110123141001.000|20110123141002.000|CC1|WRITING.                        
20110123141002.000|20110123141005.000|CC1|EVERY DAY WE SEND 294 BILLION   
20110123141005.000|20110123141007.000|CC1|EMAILS AND NEARLY FIVE BILLION  
20110123141007.000|20110123141009.000|CC1|TEXT MESSAGES BUT FOR ADULTS    
20110123141009.000|20110123141011.000|CC1|THE TACTILE PERSONAL ART OF     
20110123141011.000|20110123141012.000|CC1|HANDWRITING-- YOU'RE LOOKING    
20110123141012.000|20110123141014.000|CC1|AT MINE-- HAS PRETTY MUCH BEEN  
20110123141014.000|20110123141016.000|CC1|REDUCED TO SHOPPING LISTS AND   
20110123141016.000|20110123141018.000|CC1|CREDIT CARD SIGNATURES.         
20110123141018.000|20110123141021.000|CC1|>> WE DON'T USE IT AS MUCH,     
20110123141021.000|20110123141023.000|CC1|BUT THAT'S AN OLD STORY.        
20110123141023.000|20110123141024.000|CC1|WE HAVEN'T USED HANDWRITING     
20110123141024.000|20110123141026.000|CC1|THE WAY WE USED TO USE          
20110123141026.000|20110123141028.000|CC1|HANDWRITING FOR WELL OVER 100   
20110123141028.000|20110123141029.000|CC1|YEARS.                          
20110123141029.000|20110123141031.000|CC1|THIS IS FROM THE 1880s.         
20110123141031.000|20110123141033.000|CC1|>> Reporter: THIS WOMAN IS A    
20110123141033.000|20110123141034.000|CC1|HISTORY PROFESSOR AT THE STATE  
20110123141034.000|20110123141034.000|CC1|UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK AT       
20110123141034.000|20110123141035.000|CC1|BUFFALO.                        
20110123141035.000|20110123141037.000|CC1|AND THE AUTHOR OF A HISTORY OF  
20110123141037.000|20110123141039.000|CC1|HANDWRITING IN AMERICA.         
20110123141039.000|20110123141040.000|CC1|WHAT WAS THE HANDWRITING OF     
20110123141040.000|20110123141042.000|CC1|THE PILGRIMS LIKE?              
20110123141042.000|20110123141044.000|CC1|>> WELL, FIRST YOU HAVE TO      
20110123141044.000|20110123141045.000|CC1|RECOGNIZE THAT NOT EVERYBODY    
20110123141045.000|20110123141047.000|CC1|COULD WRITE.                    
20110123141047.000|20110123141049.000|CC1|AND THEN EVEN MORE STRANGELY    
20110123141049.000|20110123141051.000|CC1|THERE WERE PEOPLE WHO COULD     
20110123141051.000|20110123141053.000|CC1|READ BUT NOT WRITE.             
20110123141053.000|20110123141055.000|CC1|THE TWO SKILLS WERE TAUGHT      
20110123141055.000|20110123141056.000|CC1|SEPARATELY AND UCHBD TO HAVE    
20110123141056.000|20110123141057.000|CC1|SEPARATE PURPOSES.              
20110123141057.000|20110123141101.000|CC1|>> Reporter: IN THE 1700 AND    
20110123141101.000|20110123141103.000|CC1|1800s, IF YOUR HANDWRITING WAS  
20110123141103.000|20110123141104.000|CC1|GOOD ENOUGH, YOU COULD          
20110123141104.000|20110123141105.000|CC1|ACTUALLY MAKE IT A CAREER.      
20110123141105.000|20110123141105.000|CC1|>> WELL, THERE WERE             
20110123141105.000|20110123141109.000|CC1|PROFESSIONAL PENMEN,            
20110123141109.000|20110123141110.000|CC1|PROFESSIONAL WRITING MASTERS    
20110123141110.000|20110123141114.000|CC1|WHO WOULD PRODUCE PENMANSHIP    
20110123141114.000|20110123141115.000|CC1|TOUR DE FORCES AS A KIND OF     
20110123141115.000|20110123141116.000|CC1|CALLING CARD.                   
20110123141116.000|20110123141117.000|CC1|THIS IS WHAT I CAN DO.          
20110123141117.000|20110123141120.000|CC1|>> Reporter: FLAT ROGERS        
20110123141120.000|20110123141122.000|CC1|SPENCER WAS THE FIRST AMERICAN  
20110123141122.000|20110123141123.000|CC1|PENMAN TO CREATE A NATIONAL     
20110123141123.000|20110123141124.000|CC1|MODEL FOR HANDWRITING.          
20110123141124.000|20110123141126.000|CC1|IT WAS A FANCY ONE.             
20110123141126.000|20110123141130.000|CC1|>> SPENCERIAN WAS VERY FUSSY    
20110123141130.000|20110123141132.000|CC1|AND TIME CONSUMING.             
20110123141132.000|20110123141133.000|CC1|YOU HAD TO GET THE SHADING      
20110123141133.000|20110123141135.000|CC1|JUST RIGHT.                     
20110123141135.000|20110123141137.000|CC1|IT WOULD FLOW.                  
20110123141137.000|20110123141139.000|CC1|>> Reporter: WE KNOW            
20110123141139.000|20110123141140.000|CC1|SPENCERIAN TODAY AS THE SCRIPT  
20110123141140.000|20110123141144.000|CC1|USED IN THE COCA-COLA LEAGUER   
20110123141144.000|20110123141147.000|CC1|BUT THAT'S ABOUT ALL.           
20110123141147.000|20110123141148.000|CC1|BECAUSE THE ARRIVAL OF THE      
20110123141148.000|20110123141150.000|CC1|TYPEWRITER IN THE LATE 19th     
20110123141150.000|20110123141152.000|CC1|CENTURY PRESENTED ENORMOUS      
20110123141152.000|20110123141157.000|CC1|COMPETITION FOR HANDWRITING.    
20110123141157.000|20110123141158.000|CC1|A NEW MAN TOOK UP THE           
20110123141158.000|20110123141201.000|CC1|CHALLENGE, A.N.PALMER.          
20110123141201.000|20110123141203.000|CC1|>> HE REALLY WAS THE            
20110123141203.000|20110123141206.000|CC1|PENMANSHIP EMPEROR OF THE 20th  
20110123141206.000|20110123141206.000|CC1|CENTURY.                        
20110123141206.000|20110123141208.000|CC1|>> Reporter: PALMER SAID SPEED  
20110123141208.000|20110123141208.000|CC1|IT UP.                          
20110123141208.000|20110123141210.000|CC1|>> WHAT PALMER WAS THINKING     
20110123141210.000|20110123141212.000|CC1|AND TO SOME EXTENT SAYING IS    
20110123141212.000|20110123141213.000|CC1|WE HAVE TO HAVE A MODERN 20th

20110123141217.000|20110123141219.000|CC1|CENTURY BUSINESS CONDITIONS.    
20110123141219.000|20110123141219.000|CC1|FAST.

20110123141220.000|20110123141221.000|CC1|THAT WAY WE CAN KEEP UP WITH    
20110123141221.000|20110123141223.000|CC1|THE TYPEWRITER.                 
20110123141223.000|20110123141225.000|CC1|IT'S BIG ON DRILL WORK.         
20110123141225.000|20110123141227.000|CC1|>> Reporter: REGIMENTATION      
20110123141227.000|20110123141228.000|CC1|THAT PALMER BELIEVED WOULD DO   
20110123141228.000|20110123141230.000|CC1|MORE THAN JUST CREATE GOOD      
20110123141230.000|20110123141230.000|CC1|HANDWRITING.

20110123141233.000|20110123141237.000|CC1|>> PENMANSHIP COULD REFORM      
20110123141237.000|20110123141238.000|CC1|DELINQUENTS.                    
20110123141238.000|20110123141240.000|CC1|PENMANSHIP COULD ASSIMILATE     
20110123141240.000|20110123141241.000|CC1|IMMIGRANTS.                     
20110123141241.000|20110123141242.000|CC1|PENMANSHIP COULD DO JUST ABOUT  
20110123141242.000|20110123141244.000|CC1|EVERYTHING EXCEPT CURE ACNE.    
20110123141244.000|20110123141246.000|CC1|>> Reporter: MOREOVER           
20110123141246.000|20110123141247.000|CC1|HANDWRITING WAS SEEN NOT JUST   
20110123141247.000|20110123141248.000|CC1|AS A PRODUCT OF GOOD HABITS     
20110123141248.000|20110123141250.000|CC1|BUT OF YOUR CHARACTER ITSELF.   
20110123141250.000|20110123141253.000|CC1|THAT GAVE RISE TO HANDWRITING   
20110123141253.000|20110123141254.000|CC1|ANALYSIS.                       
20110123141254.000|20110123141258.000|CC1|>> IT WAS ALL THE RAGE          
20110123141258.000|20110123141259.000|CC1|PARTICULARLY IN THE EARLY       
20110123141259.000|20110123141300.000|CC1|1900s.                          
20110123141300.000|20110123141302.000|CC1|>> Reporter: THERE WERE EVEN

20110123141303.000|20110123141305.000|CC1|MAGAZINES TO WHICH READERS

20110123141306.000|20110123141306.000|CC1|HANDWRITING.                    
20110123141306.000|20110123141309.000|CC1|>> WHAT HANDWRITING REVEALS.    
20110123141309.000|20110123141310.000|CC1|>> Reporter: AND FIND OUT

20110123141311.000|20110123141312.000|CC1|>> WHAT I SEE IN YOUR           
20110123141312.000|20110123141313.000|CC1|HANDWRITING, I SEE A GREAT      
20110123141313.000|20110123141315.000|CC1|DEAL OF CONSCIENTIOUSNESS AND   
20110123141315.000|20110123141316.000|CC1|SINCERITY.

20110123141318.000|20110123141320.000|CC1|PRIGISHNESS, CONSIDERABLE       
20110123141320.000|20110123141320.000|CC1|SELF-SATISFACTION.              
20110123141320.000|20110123141321.000|CC1|>> Reporter: AND GET THIS.      
20110123141321.000|20110123141324.000|CC1|BEFORE THE 1920s, STUDENTS      
20110123141324.000|20110123141325.000|CC1|WEREN'T TAUGHT TO WRITE IN

20110123141333.000|20110123141334.000|CC1|>> Reporter: AND LEARNING

20110123141349.000|20110123141350.000|CC1|WAY.                            
20110123141350.000|20110123141351.000|CC1|>> Reporter: SHE SAYS THEY'VE

20110123141353.000|20110123141355.000|CC1|SUBJECTS CRAMMED INTO A

20110123141359.000|20110123141359.000|CC1|INSTRUCTION.                    
20110123141359.000|20110123141400.000|CC1|>> Reporter: TODAY CHILDREN     
20110123141400.000|20110123141402.000|CC1|START WITH PRINT AND THEN MOVE  
20110123141402.000|20110123141405.000|CC1|ON TO CURSIVE.                  
20110123141405.000|20110123141406.000|CC1|>> THE SCRIPT WE TEACH KIDS     
20110123141406.000|20110123141409.000|CC1|TODAY IS SIMPLE AND EFFICIENT.  
20110123141409.000|20110123141410.000|CC1|AMERICANS ARE ALL ABOUT         
20110123141410.000|20110123141411.000|CC1|EFFICIENCY.                     
20110123141411.000|20110123141414.000|CC1|>> Reporter: STEVE GRAHAM IS A  
20110123141414.000|20110123141415.000|CC1|LITERACY EXPERT AT VANDERBILT   
20110123141415.000|20110123141416.000|CC1|UNIVERSITY.                     
20110123141416.000|20110123141417.000|CC1|GRAHAM SAYS THAT JUST AS        
20110123141417.000|20110123141419.000|CC1|COMPUTERS ARE A TECHNOLOGY, SO  
20110123141419.000|20110123141421.000|CC1|ARE PENCILS AND PAPER.          
20110123141421.000|20110123141422.000|CC1|OUR PEN AND PENCIL STILL THE    
20110123141422.000|20110123141424.000|CC1|MOST PRACTICAL TECHNOLOGY WE    
20110123141424.000|20110123141424.000|CC1|HAVE?                           
20110123141424.000|20110123141426.000|CC1|>> WELL, THEY'RE CLEARLY THE    
20110123141426.000|20110123141427.000|CC1|SIMPLEST.                       
20110123141427.000|20110123141428.000|CC1|THEY'RE THE CHEAPEST.           
20110123141428.000|20110123141429.000|CC1|AND IN MANY WAYS THE MOST       
20110123141429.000|20110123141430.000|CC1|PORTABLE.                       
20110123141430.000|20110123141433.000|CC1|ARE THEY THE MOST EFFECTIVE?    
20110123141433.000|20110123141434.000|CC1|THAT'S A DIFFERENT QUESTION.    
20110123141434.000|20110123141436.000|CC1|IF YOU TAKE A LOOK AT HAVING    
20110123141436.000|20110123141437.000|CC1|KIDS WRITE ON WORD PROCESSORS   
20110123141437.000|20110123141439.000|CC1|OVER A PERIOD OF TIME VERSUS    
20110123141439.000|20110123141441.000|CC1|WRITING BY HAND, KIDS WHO       
20110123141441.000|20110123141443.000|CC1|WRITE ON WORD PROCESSORS OVER   
20110123141443.000|20110123141444.000|CC1|TIME HAVE BETTER QUALITY        
20110123141444.000|20110123141445.000|CC1|WRITING.                        
20110123141445.000|20110123141447.000|CC1|>> Reporter: SO IF KIDS JUST    
20110123141447.000|20110123141448.000|CC1|BY PASSED HANDWRITING           
20110123141448.000|20110123141450.000|CC1|ALTOGETHER AND STARTED ON       
20110123141450.000|20110123141452.000|CC1|KEYBOARD, WOULD THEY SUFFER?    
20110123141452.000|20110123141454.000|CC1|>> PROBABLY NOT.                
20110123141454.000|20110123141455.000|CC1|>> Reporter: OTHERS DISAGREE    
20110123141455.000|20110123141456.000|CC1|WITH GRAHAM.                    
20110123141456.000|20110123141458.000|CC1|CITING STUDIES THAT SHOW THAT   
20110123141458.000|20110123141500.000|CC1|FOR KIDS HANDWRITING IS MORE    
20110123141500.000|20110123141502.000|CC1|EFFECTIVE THAN TYPING FOR       
20110123141502.000|20110123141502.000|CC1|STIMULATING MEMORY AND          
20110123141502.000|20110123141504.000|CC1|LANGUAGE SKILLS.                
20110123141504.000|20110123141505.000|CC1|AND WITH COMPUTERS STILL        
20110123141505.000|20110123141508.000|CC1|SCARCE IN SOME CLASSROOMS AND   
20110123141508.000|20110123141510.000|CC1|KEYBOARDS A POOR FIT FOR KIDS'  
20110123141510.000|20110123141512.000|CC1|HANDS, ALL AGREE PENMANSHIP     
20110123141512.000|20110123141514.000|CC1|COUNTS.                         
20110123141514.000|20110123141515.000|CC1|>> IT DOES MATTER.              
20110123141515.000|20110123141517.000|CC1|PEOPLE FORM JUDGMENTS ABOUT     
20110123141517.000|20110123141519.000|CC1|THE CREDIBILITY OF YOUR IDEAS   
20110123141519.000|20110123141521.000|CC1|BASED UPON YOUR HANDWRITING.    
20110123141521.000|20110123141522.000|CC1|>> Reporter: SO A KID WITH      
20110123141522.000|20110123141523.000|CC1|GOOD HANDWRITING COULD GET      
20110123141523.000|20110123141524.000|CC1|BETTER GRADES?                  
20110123141524.000|20110123141525.000|CC1|>> YES.                         
20110123141525.000|20110123141527.000|CC1|AND A KID WITH POOR             
20110123141527.000|20110123141528.000|CC1|HANDWRITING GETS LOWER GRADES   
20110123141528.000|20110123141529.000|CC1|ON WRITING ASSIGNMENTS.         
20110123141529.000|20110123141531.000|CC1|>> Reporter: DOES OUR           
20110123141531.000|20110123141532.000|CC1|LEGIBILITY GET BETTER AS WE     
20110123141532.000|20110123141532.000|CC1|GET OLDER?                      
20110123141532.000|20110123141533.000|CC1|>> NO.                          
20110123141533.000|20110123141535.000|CC1|WHAT HAPPENS IS YOU TEND TO     
20110123141535.000|20110123141539.000|CC1|PEAK AROUND 4th GRADE.          
20110123141539.000|20110123141540.000|CC1|SO MOST HANDWRITING             
20110123141540.000|20110123141542.000|CC1|INSTRUCTION STOPS AT ABOUT 4th  
20110123141542.000|20110123141542.000|CC1|GRADE.                          
20110123141542.000|20110123141545.000|CC1|>> Reporter: SOME OF US ARE     
20110123141545.000|20110123141546.000|CC1|REMINDED OF THAT FOURTH GRADE   
20110123141546.000|20110123141547.000|CC1|PEAK THE HARD WAY.

20110123141827.000|20110123141829.000|CC1|That's the day you do something.
20110123141829.000|20110123141830.000|CC1|       Depression hurts.        
20110123141830.000|20110123141830.000|CC1|  Cymbalta can help with many   
20110123141830.000|20110123141833.000|CC1|    symptoms of depression.     
20110123141833.000|20110123141833.000|CC1| Tell your doctor right away if 
20110123141833.000|20110123141836.000|CC1|    your depression worsens,    
20110123141836.000|20110123141836.000|CC1|  you have unusual changes in   
20110123141836.000|20110123141839.000|CC1|behavior or thoughts of suicide.
20110123141839.000|20110123141839.000|CC1|  Antidepressants can increase  
20110123141839.000|20110123141839.000|CC1| these in children, teens, and  
20110123141839.000|20110123141842.000|CC1|         young adults.          
20110123141842.000|20110123141842.000|CC1|  Cymbalta is not approved for  
20110123141842.000|20110123141845.000|CC1|       children under 18.       
20110123141845.000|20110123141845.000|CC1|     People taking MAOIs or     
20110123141845.000|20110123141847.000|CC1|          thioridazine          
20110123141847.000|20110123141847.000|CC1| or with uncontrolled glaucoma  
20110123141847.000|20110123141850.000|CC1|   should not take Cymbalta.    
20110123141850.000|20110123141850.000|CC1|   Taking it with NSAID pain    
20110123141850.000|20110123141851.000|CC1|           relievers,           
20110123141851.000|20110123141851.000|CC1| aspirin, or blood thinners may 
20110123141851.000|20110123141854.000|CC1|    increase bleeding risk.     
20110123141854.000|20110123141854.000|CC1|  Severe liver problems, some   
20110123141854.000|20110123141856.000|CC1|     fatal, were reported.      
20110123141856.000|20110123141856.000|CC1|Signs include abdominal pain and
20110123141856.000|20110123141900.000|CC1| yellowing of the skin or eyes. 
20110123141900.000|20110123141900.000|CC1|Talk with your doctor about your
20110123141900.000|20110123141902.000|CC1|           medicines,           
20110123141902.000|20110123141902.000|CC1|including those for migraine, or
20110123141902.000|20110123141904.000|CC1|    if you have high fever,     
20110123141904.000|20110123141906.000|CC1|  confusion and stiff muscles,  
20110123141906.000|20110123141906.000|CC1|     to address a possible      
20110123141906.000|20110123141908.000|CC1|  life-threatening condition.   
20110123141908.000|20110123141908.000|CC1| Tell your doctor about alcohol 
20110123141908.000|20110123141910.000|CC1|      use, liver disease,       
20110123141910.000|20110123141910.000|CC1| and before you reduce or stop  
20110123141910.000|20110123141913.000|CC1|        taking Cymbalta.

20110123143443.000|20110123143447.000|CC1|20 TIMES THE USUAL .3 INCHES.

20110123143555.000|20110123143555.000|CC1|        [ Male Announcer ]      
20110123143555.000|20110123143557.000|CC1|      IT'S SIMPLE PHYSICS...    
20110123143557.000|20110123143557.000|CC1|          A BODY AT REST        
20110123143557.000|20110123143559.000|CC1|     TENDS TO STAY AT REST...   
20110123143558.000|20110123143558.000|XDS|%    TITLE:   
20110123143559.000|20110123143559.000|CC1|      WHILE A BODY IN MOTION    
20110123143559.000|20110123143602.000|CC1|     TENDS TO STAY IN MOTION.   
20110123143559.000|20110123143559.000|XDS|%    TITLE: PFCX0007000H
20110123143602.000|20110123143602.000|CC1|   STAYING ACTIVE CAN ACTUALLY  
20110123143602.000|20110123143605.000|CC1|     EASE ARTHRITIS SYMPTOMS.   
20110123143605.000|20110123143606.000|CC1|    BUT IF YOU HAVE ARTHRITIS,  
20110123143606.000|20110123143606.000|CC1|          STAYING ACTIVE        
20110123143606.000|20110123143608.000|CC1|        CAN BE DIFFICULT.       
20110123143608.000|20110123143608.000|CC1|      PRESCRIPTION CELEBREX     
20110123143608.000|20110123143611.000|CC1| CAN HELP RELIEVE ARTHRITIS PAIN
20110123143611.000|20110123143611.000|CC1|           SO YOUR BODY         
20110123143611.000|20110123143613.000|CC1|       CAN STAY IN MOTION.      
20110123143613.000|20110123143613.000|CC1|         BECAUSE JUST ONE       
20110123143613.000|20110123143616.000|CC1|       200MG CELEBREX A DAY     
20110123143616.000|20110123143618.000|CC1|    CAN PROVIDE 24 HOUR RELIEF  
20110123143618.000|20110123143618.000|CC1|   FOR MANY WITH ARTHRITIS PAIN 
20110123143618.000|20110123143621.000|CC1|        AND INFLAMMATION.       
20110123143621.000|20110123143622.000|CC1|    PLUS, IN CLINICAL STUDIES,  
20110123143622.000|20110123143622.000|CC1|  CELEBREX IS PROVEN TO IMPROVE 
20110123143622.000|20110123143625.000|CC1|     DAILY PHYSICAL FUNCTION    
20110123143625.000|20110123143626.000|CC1|       SO MOVING IS EASIER.     
20110123143626.000|20110123143628.000|CC1| AND CELEBREX IS NOT A NARCOTIC.
20110123143628.000|20110123143628.000|CC1|    WHEN IT COMES TO RELIEVING  
20110123143628.000|20110123143630.000|CC1|       YOUR ARTHRITIS PAIN,     
20110123143630.000|20110123143630.000|CC1|       YOU AND YOUR DOCTOR      
20110123143630.000|20110123143632.000|CC1|   NEED TO BALANCE THE BENEFITS 
20110123143632.000|20110123143633.000|CC1|         WITH THE RISKS.        
20110123143633.000|20110123143633.000|CC1|     ALL PRESCRIPTION NSAIDS,   
20110123143633.000|20110123143636.000|CC1|       INCLUDING CELEBREX,      
20110123143636.000|20110123143636.000|CC1|     MAY INCREASE THE CHANCE    
20110123143636.000|20110123143637.000|CC1|    OF HEART ATTACK OR STROKE,  
20110123143637.000|20110123143639.000|CC1|     WHICH CAN LEAD TO DEATH.   
20110123143639.000|20110123143639.000|CC1|      THIS CHANCE INCREASES     
20110123143639.000|20110123143641.000|CC1|    IF YOU HAVE HEART DISEASE   
20110123143641.000|20110123143641.000|CC1|         OR RISK FACTORS        
20110123143641.000|20110123143643.000|CC1|   SUCH AS HIGH BLOOD PRESSURE  
20110123143643.000|20110123143643.000|CC1|     OR WHEN NSAIDS ARE TAKEN   
20110123143643.000|20110123143645.000|CC1|        FOR LONG PERIODS.       
20110123143645.000|20110123143647.000|CC1|   NSAIDS, INCLUDING CELEBREX,  
20110123143647.000|20110123143647.000|CC1|  INCREASE THE CHANCE OF SERIOUS
20110123143647.000|20110123143649.000|CC1|    SKIN OR ALLERGIC REACTIONS  
20110123143649.000|20110123143649.000|CC1|     OR STOMACH AND INTESTINE   
20110123143649.000|20110123143651.000|CC1|            PROBLEMS,           
20110123143651.000|20110123143653.000|CC1|   SUCH AS BLEEDING AND ULCERS, 
20110123143653.000|20110123143653.000|CC1| WHICH CAN OCCUR WITHOUT WARNING
20110123143653.000|20110123143655.000|CC1|       AND MAY CAUSE DEATH.     
20110123143655.000|20110123143655.000|CC1|   PATIENTS ALSO TAKING ASPIRIN 
20110123143655.000|20110123143658.000|CC1|         AND THE ELDERLY        
20110123143658.000|20110123143658.000|CC1|    ARE AT INCREASED RISK FOR   
20110123143658.000|20110123143700.000|CC1|   STOMACH BLEEDING AND ULCERS. 
20110123143700.000|20110123143700.000|CC1|  DO NOT TAKE CELEBREX IF YOU'VE
20110123143700.000|20110123143703.000|CC1|   HAD AN ASTHMA ATTACK, HIVES, 
20110123143703.000|20110123143703.000|CC1|  OR OTHER ALLERGIES TO ASPIRIN,
20110123143703.000|20110123143706.000|CC1|     NSAIDS OR SULFONAMIDES.    
20110123143706.000|20110123143706.000|CC1| GET HELP RIGHT AWAY IF YOU HAVE
20110123143706.000|20110123143708.000|CC1| SWELLING OF THE FACE OR THROAT,
20110123143708.000|20110123143710.000|CC1|      OR TROUBLE BREATHING.     
20110123143710.000|20110123143710.000|CC1|         TELL YOUR DOCTOR       
20110123143710.000|20110123143712.000|CC1|    ABOUT YOUR MEDICAL HISTORY  
20110123143712.000|20110123143712.000|CC1| AND FIND AN ARTHRITIS TREATMENT
20110123143712.000|20110123143714.000|CC1|       THAT WORKS FOR YOU.      
20110123143714.000|20110123143717.000|CC1| ASK YOUR DOCTOR ABOUT CELEBREX.

20110123144038.000|20110123144040.000|CC1|NOT JUST ANOTHER PIECE OF

20110123144041.000|20110123144042.000|CC1|AS I'LL EXPLAIN IN A MOMENT,    
20110123144042.000|20110123144043.000|CC1|IT'S PERSONAL.                  
20110123144043.000|20110123144045.000|CC1|BUT TO UNDERSTAND JAN'S         
20110123144045.000|20110123144047.000|CC1|TRAGEDY, YOU MUST UNDERSTAND    
20110123144047.000|20110123144049.000|CC1|WHAT HAPPENS WHEN ALZHEIMER'S   
20110123144049.000|20110123144051.000|CC1|STRIKES ONE SO YOUNG.           
20110123144051.000|20110123144053.000|CC1|>> ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE IS A     
20110123144053.000|20110123144058.000|CC1|CONDITION THAT AFFECTS THE      
20110123144058.000|20110123144100.000|CC1|WHOLE WAY SOMEONE IS.           
20110123144100.000|20110123144102.000|CC1|IT AFFECTS THEIR PERSONALITY.   
20110123144102.000|20110123144103.000|CC1|IT AFFECTS THEIR BEHAVIOR.      
20110123144103.000|20110123144105.000|CC1|IT AFFECTS THEIR THINKING,      
20110123144105.000|20110123144105.000|CC1|THEIR MEMORY.                   
20110123144105.000|20110123144106.000|CC1|IT AFFECTS THEIR ABILITY TO     
20110123144106.000|20110123144107.000|CC1|SPEAK.                          
20110123144107.000|20110123144109.000|CC1|>> Reporter: DR. JAMES GALVIN   
20110123144109.000|20110123144112.000|CC1|IS PROFESSOR OF NEUROLOGY AND   
20110123144112.000|20110123144113.000|CC1|PSYCHIATRY AT NEW YORK          
20110123144113.000|20110123144115.000|CC1|UNIVERSITY'S MEDICAL CENTER.    
20110123144115.000|20110123144117.000|CC1|HE SAYS MOST ALZHEIMER'S        
20110123144117.000|20110123144119.000|CC1|PATIENTS ARE IN THEIR 70s AND   
20110123144119.000|20110123144120.000|CC1|80s.                            
20110123144120.000|20110123144122.000|CC1|BUT IT CAN ALSO STRIKE AS       
20110123144122.000|20110123144125.000|CC1|YOUNG AS 30 WHEN IT IS CALLED   
20110123144125.000|20110123144127.000|CC1|EARLY OR YOUNGER ONSET.         
20110123144127.000|20110123144129.000|CC1|>> THERE ARE ABOUT 250,000      
20110123144129.000|20110123144130.000|CC1|AMERICANS WHO HAVE THE DISEASE  
20110123144130.000|20110123144131.000|CC1|BEFORE AGE 65.                  
20110123144131.000|20110123144133.000|CC1|>> Reporter: THE FIRST THING    
20110123144133.000|20110123144134.000|CC1|TO KNOW ABOUT ALZHEIMERS IS     
20110123144134.000|20110123144137.000|CC1|THAT THERE IS NO CURE.          
20110123144137.000|20110123144139.000|CC1|THE SECOND, THERE IS NO KNOWN   
20110123144139.000|20110123144140.000|CC1|CAUSE.                          
20110123144140.000|20110123144143.000|CC1|AND EVEN WORSE, SAYS BETH, A    
20110123144143.000|20110123144145.000|CC1|SENIOR DIRECTOR AT THE          
20110123144145.000|20110123144147.000|CC1|ALZHEIMERS ASSOCIATION....      
20110123144147.000|20110123144148.000|CC1|>> THERE'S NO EVIDENCE THAT     
20110123144148.000|20110123144149.000|CC1|SHOWS THAT YOU CAN PREVENT      
20110123144149.000|20110123144150.000|CC1|ALZHEIMERS DISEASE.             
20110123144150.000|20110123144151.000|CC1|>> Reporter: YOU CAN'T DO A     
20110123144151.000|20110123144153.000|CC1|MILLION CROSS WORD PUZZLES?     
20110123144153.000|20110123144154.000|CC1|>> RIGHT NOW WHAT THE RESEARCH  
20110123144154.000|20110123144155.000|CC1|IS SHOWING US IS THAT YOU       
20110123144155.000|20110123144157.000|CC1|CANNOT STOP IT BY DOING         
20110123144157.000|20110123144158.000|CC1|CERTAIN THINGS.                 
20110123144158.000|20110123144200.000|CC1|>> Reporter: AND AS BABY        
20110123144200.000|20110123144202.000|CC1|BOOMERS AGE, THE PROBLEM WILL   
20110123144202.000|20110123144204.000|CC1|GET FAR WORSE.
